font.marquee: School closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.

p.span: Today, Governor Kim Reynolds announced that all schools in Iowa will remain closed through the end of the school year to help prevent the further spread of COVID-19.

This announcement will continue to affect all Van Buren County Community School District programming, including before- and after-school activities, all athletic and extracurricular practices and competitions, and all weekend events. It is our hope that we will be able to reschedule prom and graduation for sometime this summer, but we do not yet know how these events will look. Summer sports have yet to be cancelled, and we are told we will have more guidance no later than June 1.

I know this decision has caused a great deal of concern and disappointment for our students, staff, and families. The pandemic arrived quickly, and when we first were directed to close our school buildings in March, we did not realize it would be the last time we would see our students in person this school year. Please know that we share in your disappointment.

Per our district calendar, the last day of school for students is Friday, May 22. We will continue with virtual learning and learning packet handouts on Thursdays, until that date, just as we have over the past several weeks. We encourage all families to keep their students engaged in these activities to ensure learning continues to take place through the end of the school year. Our staff is ready to assist all families in these efforts, as well.

We need our families’ support in engaging students in the learning resources we have provided. Please encourage and assist your children with learning opportunities as much as you can. Please know that while learning is important, so is the mental health and relationships that exist in your home. Please continue to do as much as you can while attempting to make learning a fun event. If it feels like a chore, stop, take a break and come back to it tomorrow.

We will continue school lunch services through the extended school closure, as well. Currently, we are delivering a week’s worth of meals and breakfasts each Wednesday. These deliveries ensure meals for each school day through May 22. The last day of meal delivery will be on Wednesday, May 13 and will include 8 meals and breakfasts.

More details will come in the coming weeks regarding locker clean out, gathering any school supplies and other personal belongings, turning in technological devices and textbooks as well as any other pertinent details.

Once again, thank you for your patience, understanding, and flexibility during this time. We will get through this together. Please continue to stay safe, practice social distancing, and remain at home as much as possible. Have a blessed day!.

h3.a: School Meal Delivery to Sites begins April 15

div.p: Reminder: School meals will be delivered to the following sites each Wednesday starting April 15 from 11 to 11:15 a.m. through April 29 and will include a week's worth of breakfasts and lunches. Van Buren Jr/Sr High School, Milton City Park, Stockport City Park, Bonaparte Old Elementary School, Douds Elementary, Wild Rose Shelter in Farmington, Hillsboro City Park, Birmingham City Park, and the Cantril City Park next to the ball . . .

div.p:
Letter to Elementary Parents/Guardians
Elementary Office Hours

a.aria-label: Read more about Elementary Office Hours

div.p:
Good evening Van Buren County,
The Governor has announced an order to keep PK-12 schools closed until April 30th. Therefore, schools will be closed through April 30, 2020. Lunches will be delivered tomorrow, Friday April 3rd as regularly scheduled and will include all meals for next week as well . Starting on Wednesday, April 15 we will hand out 5 meals and food bank sacks, thus beginning a once per . . .

div.p:
Building Hours During Cancellation (open for phone calls and emails, visitors by appointment only)
All Educational Centers Tuesday and Thursday 8:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. District Office, Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday 8:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.
Will we still have Prom?
At this time the CDC is recommending no gathering of more than 50 people for the next 8 weeks. Because prom would include more than 50 . . .

div.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

div.div: NOTICE OF NONDISCRIMINATION Students, parents, employees and others doing business with or performing services for the Van Buren Community School District are hereby notified that this school district does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, age (except students), religion, national origin, creed, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic status or disability in admission or access to, or treatment in, its programs and activities. The school district does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, age (except students), religion, national origin, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or disability in admission or access to, or treatment in, its hiring and employment practices. Any person having inquiries concerning the school district's compliance with the regulations implementing Title VI, Title VII, Title IX, the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), § 504 or Iowa Code § 280.3 is directed to contact: Superintendent, Van Buren District / Superintendent office, Van Buren County Community School District Office, 807 1st Street, PO Box 220, Keosauqua, Iowa 52565, 319-293-3334, who has been designated by the school district to coordinate the school district's efforts to comply with the regulations implementing Title VI, Title VII, Title IX, the ADA, § 504 and Iowa Code § 280.3.
